alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Kingfisher; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:43AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Washita, southwestern Kingfisher, northern Caddo, southeastern Roger Mills, Custer, southern Blaine, southeastern Dewey, western Canadian and eastern Beckham Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 243 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Watonga to 4 miles east of Arapaho to 7 miles west of Elk City. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Reno, Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Cordell, Hinton, Burns Flat, Geary, Okarche, Thomas, Hydro, Sentinel, Arapaho, Binger, Hammon, Dill City, Canute, Calumet, and Corn. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 26 and 122. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Kingfisher; Roger Mills; Washita
